intro: Ouratea stipulacea var. tridentata, commonly known as the Trinidadian white satalia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean, particularly Trinidad and Tobago. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white, clustered flowers and its distinctive three-lobed leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. The varietal form, tridentata, refers to its uniquely shaped leaf lobes, which are three-pointed and contribute to its ornamental appeal.
